channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI

item.title: Report X-2024040022
item.description:
Report X-2024040022

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO, CLEANED UP, AND TRANSPORTED TO DMP. UPON INSPECTION IN THE DMP IT WAS FOUND THAT THE CAPS OF 3 OUT OF 4 1 GALLON BOTTLES WERE LOOSE AND THE CONTAINERS LEAKED. THE 4TH BOTTLE WAS NOT LEAKING BUT THE LABEL AND BOTTLE WERE SOILED AND WET FROM THE OTHER LEAKERS.

item.title: Report E-2024040053
item.description:
Report E-2024040053

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was unloading the IBCs from a trailer at Veolia's ten day intransit facility and noticed that six out of the twelve bags had leaked inside the trailer. The waste was F039 filter cake that should have been all solid but instead had residual liquid left over from the process. Over time, the liquid settled out and leaked from the package. The liquid that leaked was absorbed with oil dry and the material was repacked before being shipped to the disposal facility.
